item.title: Loyalty: A Primer For My Friends and Family
item.description: Loyalty is a bit of a dirty word. It’s been associated with so many unpleasant ideas, actions, and movements that it’s hard for us to overcome its nauseating baggage. When loyalty is mentioned, we are more likely to remember the Nuremberg trials than the civil rights movement. We’re more likely to imagine lackeys and lickspittles than we are heroes – and even our images of loyal heroes are likely to be re-examined through lenses that reveal their privilege, supremacy and appropriation.
